DataElement.preferredName: Hospital Specific National Provider Identifier Facility Number Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: This field identifies the CoC Facility Identification Number (FIN) of the facility at the time it originally accessioned the tumor.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Hospital Specific National Provider Identifier Facility
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The field that identifies the facility that originally accessioned the tumor.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An institution that provides medical, surgical, or psychiatric care and treatment for the sick or the injured.:Specified; clearly and explicitly stated.

Concepts.definition: An institution that provides medical, surgical, or psychiatric care and treatment for the sick or the injured.

Property.preferredDefinition: A system for uniquely identifying all providers of health care services, supplies, and equipment. NPIs are assigned by the National Plan and Provider Enumeration System (NPPES) and are 10-position, all-numeric identification numbers that will identify a health care provider in standard transactions, such as health care claims.:Services and space and equipment provided for a particular purpose; a building or place that provides a particular service or is used for a particular industry.

Concepts.definition: A unique identification number for health care services, supplies, and equipment providers in the United States.  NPI is assigned for use in all administrative and financial transactions specified by HIPAA. NPI is issued by the National Plan and Provider Enumeration System (NPPES) and is 10-position, all-numeric identification number with no embedded intelligence.
Services and space and equipment provided for a particular purpose; a building or place that provides a particular service or is used for a particular industry.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: groups, institutions, or clinical facilities that conduct clinical research or tests, or analyze clinical data.

DataElementConcept.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A system for uniquely identifying all providers of health care services, supplies, and equipment. NPIs are assigned by the National Plan and Provider Enumeration System (NPPES) and are 10-position, all-numeric identification numbers that will identify a health care provider in standard transactions, such as health care claims._Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual entities required by NCI operations and systems. Includes administrative, financial, organizational and quasi-scientific concepts required for NCI operations and systems.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A system for uniquely identifying all providers of health care services, supplies, and equipment. NPIs are assigned by the National Plan and Provider Enumeration System (NPPES) and are 10-position, all-numeric identification numbers that will identify a health care provider in standard transactions, such as health care claims.:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: A unique identification number for health care services, supplies, and equipment providers in the United States.  NPI is assigned for use in all administrative and financial transactions specified by HIPAA. NPI is issued by the National Plan and Provider Enumeration System (NPPES) and is 10-position, all-numeric identification number with no embedded intelligence.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ValueDomain.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Division of Cancer Control and Population Sciences

ReferenceDocuments.name: Note
ReferenceDocuments.description: CoC maintains the codes, including those for non-hospital sources of reporting.

ReferenceDocuments.name: NAACCR, V 11.1 Data Stds/Dict.
ReferenceDocuments.description: For additional details see NAACCR, Standards for Cancer Registries Volume II, Version 11.1 Data Standards and Data Dictionary (5/4/06)

ReferenceDocuments.name: Archive FIN Description
ReferenceDocuments.description: NPI, a unique identification number for health care providers, is scheduled for 2007 implementation by the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) as part of the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act of 1996 (HIPAA). When a facility starts to use the NPI codes, that information should be transmitted in the data item NPI--Archive FIN [3105].
